greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integers k among 1..n for which gcd(k,n) is a cube.
link: Daniel Suteu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000

Eckford Cohen, A class of residue systems (mod r) and related arithmetical functions. I. A generalization of the Moebius function, Pacific J. Math. 9(1) (1959), 13-24; see Section 6 where a(n) = Psi_3(n).
formula: G.f. for a(p^n), p a prime, is given by 1/(1+x+x^2)/(1-p*x).
a(n) = Sum_{d|n, d is a perfect cube} phi(n/d), where phi(k) is the Euler totient function. Dirichlet convolution of A000010 and A010057. - _Daniel Suteu_, Jun 27 2018
Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ Pi^4 * n^2 / 315. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 07 2019
Dirichlet convolution of A000027 and A210826. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 05 2020
mathematica: nn = 76; f[list_, i_] := list[[i]]; a = Table[If[IntegerQ[n^(1/3)], 1, 0], {n, 1, nn}]; b =Table[EulerPhi[n], {n, 1, nn}]; Table[DirichletConvolve[f[a, n], f[b, n], n, m], {m, 1, nn}] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 25 2015 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sum(k=1, n, ispower(gcd(n, k), 3)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 25 2015
(PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, eulerphi(n/d) * ispower(d, 3)); \\ _Daniel Suteu_, Jun 27 2018
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 29 2002
